result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Cole Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey Cole Patterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey Cole Patterson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to all other sentences.
Court notes 77 days credit against ultimate sentence.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: to all other sentences

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF435.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF435.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-MRT.
-Follow any other conditions Agent believes is necessary.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: to SRN regarding MRT update filed by Lisa Multhauf.  Per SRN 12/29/15 - file. eif
of December 1st, 2015 Sentencing Hearing. Held before the Honorable Scott R. Needham. Filed by RPR Kasten. Original in 14CF67. km
E: DOC. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO, DCF & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Minot. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle. Atty Krave also appeared. DF:  Jeffrey Cole Patterson appeared from jail. Includes 14CF67, 15CF435 and 15CM516. Case called at 1:04 pm. Court reviews files. ADA Minser makes statement. Court dismisses 15CM516. On 15CF435, Atty O'Boyle recites agreement. No objection from ADA Minser. Def pleads Guilty to Count one without repeater. Def sworn. Crt informs Def of rights. Crt finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds Def guilty of Count one without repeater enhancer. On motion of the State Crt dismisses Counts two and three. Parties make sentencing arguments. Def makes statement. Crt orders:

14CF67 -  2yrs i/c, 2 yrs e/s.  Concurrent to any current sentence
- Credit for 284 Days. 
- Def is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and CIP.  
- Costs to be paid through extended supervision

On 15CF435 - 2 yrs  probation w/h with conditions.  To run consecutive to all sentences
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and Regular Testing
- AODA and follow through
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- MRT
- Follow any other condition agent believe is necessary
- Court Costs
- Costs of Supervision
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
77 Days credit against ultimate sentence
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-01-2015 01:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Jeffrey Cole Patterson appeared. Deputy O'Keefe appeared. Case called at 11:01. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State files an Information. Court orally amends Ct. 2 and 3.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:00 am.
